image.altText: An aerial image of an industrial area which includes silos

items.synopsis: A siege that followed a fatal shooting in WA's Wheatbelt has ended with the 25-year-old gunman turning the weapon on himself.

title.children: Gunman dead following fatal workplace shooting and police stand-off

image.altText: Close up of Catherine King

items.synopsis: Transport Minister Catherine King has pledged airfares will soon come down, saying Qatar Airways is "not the only airline that adds to competition".

title.children: Catherine King says airfares 'will come down' as other airlines increase capacity

image.altText: A huge plume of smoke billows above a bushfire burning in grassland near a country road.

items.synopsis: The fire near Cecil Plains has burnt through about 1,000 hectares since it was sparked by lightning on Tuesday.

title.children: Bushfire raging in Queensland state forest jumps containment lines

image.altText: Cian English smiles for a photo while wearing a suit.

items.synopsis: The court heard the 19-year-old fell off the balcony after allegedly being beaten and tortured.

title.children: Trio plead guilty to manslaughter of teenager who plunged to his death from a Gold Coast balcony

image.altText: Qatar Airways and Qantas planes on tarmac in Perth.

items.synopsis: This week delivered a brutal lesson in how a political perception problem can suddenly become a spectacular, fridge-melting conflagration, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: At some point, love for Qantas died. What was the final straw?

image.altText: German defence officials climb on a Boxer army vehicle in australia

items.synopsis: Barely two months ago, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced a $1 billion Defence deal with Germany while visiting Berlin. But after that country missed out on a reciprocal contract, the relationship is now looking unlikely.

title.children: Growing doubts about German commitment to $1b Australian Army export deal

image.altText: An AFL player looks to the sky and screams in excitment and celebration.

items.synopsis: Collingwood has survived a late Melbourne charge to win a tense qualifying final by seven points in front of 92,000 fans at the MCG. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Collingwood holds on to win epic qualifying final over Melbourne

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: And breathe. What a finish. Collingwood are through to a preliminary final, holding off a Melbourne charge by hook or by crook to grasp desperately onto a seven-point win. The Pies started like a house on fire, building a lead before the Dees had even got off the bus. But the Melbourne fight back came, slowly at first and then all at once in that last quarter. Lesser teams would have relented, but led by Moore and Quaynor and Murphy, the Collingwood defence stood strong. The Dees will be kicking themselves tonight due to the chances they torched in the second half, but they don't have long to feel sorry for themselves. They've got either Carlton or Sydney back here at the MCG next weekend, and then it really will be do or die. But tonight is Collingwood's, as the noise from the crowd tells us in no uncertain terms. What an occasion, what a win for Collingwood.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: Collingwood win by seven points! The Pies are into a prelim!

children.content: Collingwood are through to a preliminary final, holding off a Melbourne charge by hook or by crook to grasp desperately onto a seven-point win.

The Pies started like a house on fire, building a lead before the Dees had even got off the bus. But the Melbourne fight back came, slowly at first and then all at once in that last quarter. Lesser teams would have relented, but led by Moore and Quaynor and Murphy, the Collingwood defence stood strong.

The Dees will be kicking themselves tonight due to the chances they torched in the second half, but they don't have long to feel sorry for themselves. They've got either Carlton or Sydney back here at the MCG next weekend, and then it really will be do or die.
But tonight is Collingwood's, as the noise from the crowd tells us in no uncertain terms. What an occasion, what a win for Collingwood.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Finally the Dees find a way through, and typically it came from Petracca winning the ground-ball at half-forward. Fritsch wasted no time after outmarking Moore, dribbling home the goal. Seven points the margin, 2:47 on the clock. Hold on to your hats.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 3': Fritsch goals! It's not over yet!

children.content: Finally the Dees find a way through, and typically it came from Petracca winning the ground-ball at half-forward. Fritsch wasted no time after outmarking Moore, dribbling home the goal.
Seven points the margin, 2:47 on the clock. Hold on to your hats.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It was scrappy, up until the moment Tom McDonald sent three Pies defenders to the shops with a dummy on the goal line. The left foot snap from there was beautiful from the big man. First blood Melbourne, can that spark something?
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 18': Tom McDonald! Dees strike first in final quarter!

children.content: It was scrappy, up until the moment Tom McDonald sent three Pies defenders to the shops with a dummy on the goal line. The left foot snap from there was beautiful from the big man. First blood Melbourne, can that spark something?

image.altText: An AFL player lies on a stretcher and is carted off with support staff around him.

items.synopsis: Collingwood may not be able to count on Brayden Maynard for the rest of the finals, after the defender is put on report for a collision that left Melbourne's Angus Brayshaw stretchered off the ground with concussion.

title.children: Collingwood's Brayden Maynard at risk of missing finals after concussing Brayshaw

image.altText: A group of St George Illawarra NRLW players wait for the Sydney Roosters to take a conversion attempt.

items.synopsis: Victory will boost St George Illawarra's slim finals chances, but Cronulla is standing in its way as the two teams face off for the first time in the NRLW. Follow our ScoreCentre for the live score and stats.

title.children: NRLW live: Dragons chasing win over Sharks in desperate bid to make finals

image.altText: Belinda and Kobee Huddy smile for a selfie.

items.synopsis: Early one May morning in 2019, 20-year-old Kobee Huddy was desperate for help. He called a mental health service for advice. Less than four hours later he would be dead – shot by police.

title.children: Did Kobee's cry for help kill him? How a knife-wielding mentally ill young man was fatally shot by police

image.altText: black and white photo of the exterior of the Kinchela Boys Home

image.altText: Three windswept men reach land, the sea behind them. All are grinning and have their arms around each other.

image.altText: Lowe is wearing a blue suit, looking straight into camera, sitting at a desk.

image.altText: Barbed wire on the fence at Don Dale

image.altText: A rocket with fire and smoke coming out from under in a white sand land

image.altText: Bruce Bonyhady wearing a suit and tie and smiling.

image.altText: The website for eHarmony, which has a picture of a smiling blonde, white woman

image.altText: A man chained to a flyscreen with a bike lock

image.altText: Relaxed anonymous male teenager texting on mobile phone. His face is obscured by his hands and mobile in front of him.

image.altText: a photo of a person leaning against a street pole

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket, a woman in a navy jacket sit on a green bench seat while a man stands and shouts

items.synopsis: The heated discussion over why Qatar Airways' bid to increase flights to Australia was rejected has left the government juggling excess political baggage, writes Brett Worthington.

image.altText: A female worker holds a box of nuts in a factory.

image.altText: A woman crouching looking up at a furry animal and patting it as its held by another person.
